content.title: Surveys have been sent!
content.creator:
Larry Tiefenbrunn
March 3, 2025
content.content:
Hi again everyone. I know it's a lot of updates this week but it is certainly crunch time and there's lots to get done. Most of you already know that around 8 o'clock ET this morning, BackerKit sent out 1924 surveys to all the remaining backers who were not already contacted in the "smoke test" (see Friday's update). Resoundingly, in the last eight hours, over 1100 people have already responded to their surveys. That's amazing. What wonderful backers live in the Platypod community!
If, for any reason you did not get your survey, the first thing to do is check your email spam folder. If you signed in with Apple ID or Apple Pay then you must check your Apple mail because that is likely where the survey ended up. If you still can't find it, please write to us at service@platypod.com and we will get back to you over the next few days. Please bear with us. I also plan on doing another mailing tomorrow to anyone who has not responded and again later on this week. Larry Becker (head of customer support) is going to be busy as master of ceremonies for Scott Kelby's iPhone conference this week and I will be heading to England for The Photography Show (Booth/Stand D200 -please visit us). We will still attend to your requests but please be flexible with giving us a day or two to get to all messages.
For those of you who have returned your surveys and made your purchases in the "add-on store" please be aware that I will likely lock the orders and apply any additional charges for those with add-ons sometime tomorrow (Monday March 3). Once that is done we will prepare to ship to those of you who are in the "early delivery" categories. The remainder of backers will ship on or after April 1. I think we are pretty well prepared to handle all of the March deliveries with add-ons at this point but in case we run low on supplies we are expecting more shipments later in March. My intent is to keep our projection of on-time deliveries meaning all "early delivery" categories in March and the remainder in April.
Thank you again for all your support.
Best wishes, Larry T.

content.title: Smoke test sent.
content.creator:
Larry Tiefenbrunn
March 1, 2025
content.content:
Just a brief update to let everyone know what's happening.
I just got the clearance from BackerKit to send out what is known as the "smoke test". Larry Becker and I have set up the surveys and the add-on store but to make sure there are no errors or glitches, BackerKit insists that we run this test which is randomly sent out to 5% of the backers at each pledge level. I hope that we will have some responses over the next 48 hours and if we do see responses at each level we can go ahead and send out the remainder of the surveys.
PLEASE do not write to us over this weekend as there is no one available to respond. If you do not receive your survey by Tuesday or Wednesday next week, please check back here first for another update or write to us at service@platypod.com at that point. Larry Becker will be hosting Scott Kelby's iPhone conference until end of day Wednesday but he will likely get back to you on Thursday. Please bear with us.
If all goes well I hope to have the remainder of the surveys go out either Sunday night or Monday morning. If there's a problem I will put up another update here to let everyone know. Since no shipments will go out until at least Tuesday or Wednesday next week it really doesn't matter whether you are in the smoke test group or the larger survey group. Those of you who know me, know that I will make my very best effort to get everything out as soon as humanly possible. Trying to please over 2000 people at once is rather stressful but I will do my best.
If we get a nice return from the "early delivery" backers on all the surveys and everything goes smoothly then we will try to release the first "early delivery" shipments after the first 24 hours so please return your surveys immediately. (All "regular delivery" pledges are still due to be filled during the month of April.) If you need to research and decide which add-on items you are interested in, now is the time to go to "SHOP" on our website www.platypod.com and read the descriptions or watch our videos. Again, the only major Platypod product which will not be in the add-on store is the Platyball Elite which is sold exclusively through B&H Photo in New York. Quantities may be limited on certain items so I encourage you to make your choices of add-ons as early as possible. Sorry, but our "Instant Loyalty Rebates" program will not apply to the BackerKit add-on store. As we mentioned in the last update, you will be able to add-on as many items as you like, without any increase in shipping fees...nice perk.
Best wishes to all and thank you again for your support and encouragement.
Sincerely, Larry Tiefenbrunn

content.title: A MUST READ: What’s next??? Apple ID backers beware!!! Thanks***
content.creator:
Larry Tiefenbrunn
February 18, 2025
content.content:
Well, it's been a few days since the Delta Kickstarter campaign has ended and I'm still trying to catch my breath from all the excitement.
I went into this project hoping for 1500 or 1600 backers and I can't believe that over 2000 people had the faith and confidence in us to come out with another great new product, the Platypod Delta.
There's still a lot to do. First of all, I'd like to again confirm that we've received in the New Jersey fulfillment center, over 1200 Delta retail packages ready to fulfill “early delivery” backer pledges. We do have to send a few hundred over to Belgium for those backers outside of The Americas. Here's where we will need everyone's help.
Before I explain the survey process, I would like to address an issue that has been a challenge in the past and that is for all of you who have either signed into Kickstarter using your Apple ID or paid with Apple Pay. Over the next few weeks it is imperative that you check your Apple email at least once a week or you will miss the surveys that we are going to be sending out, which are necessary to fulfill your pledges. A lot of people don't know this and we had issues with this in our past campaigns, so please pay attention to this. For everyone else, all we ask is that you please monitor the same email inbox that you signed into Kickstarter with and you should not have any problem.
Now let's talk about the surveys. For this campaign, as we have done in the past, we will be utilizing the services of BackerKit to help us send out, collate and process the information necessary for us to efficiently send your products out to you. The surveys help us gather simple yet critical information, such as confirmation of your proper names, addresses, phone numbers. It will not be one of those irritating kinds of surveys that ask you a ton of irrelevant questions only to waste your time.
Along with the surveys you will have a one time opportunity to shop for Platypod products in our “Add-on Store.” Here we will be offering many of our Platypod and Platyball products at our very lowest prices in appreciation of your support for this campaign. As a special bonus, there will be no additional shipping charges for extra items ordered. Whatever you paid for shipping in Kickstarter is your only shipping fee. All items will ship out together and if you ordered for early delivery we will do our very best to have your entire shipment go out during the month of March. Your only additional charges may be local tax and VAT which is up to the government where you live.

To enable you to choose what you want to buy efficiently, I would encourage everyone to head over to www.platypod.com and look out our “SHOP” page and write up a shopping list of the items you are interested in. Our apologies, but there is one item that we will not be able to offer and that is the Platyball Elite which is now sold exclusively at B&H Photo in New York and via their website. On the other hand, Platyball Ergo and just about all of our other products will be available at deep discounts.

Again, this is a one time only opportunity so please be prepared.

We will try our best to have the surveys ready to go out over the next two weeks but we do have to wait for the final signal from Kickstarter that all credit cards have been charged and reconciled. Invariably there are a few people whose credit cards have expired or have been denied by their banks and Kickstarter has to go back and follow up with those backers. That process ends around 14 days after the end of the campaign which is approximately March 1.

It is especially important that our “early delivery” backers return their surveys within two or three days after you receive them. We hope to start shipping about a week after the surveys go out and then again once weekly thereafter. Orders shipping out of Belgium may take a week or two longer if we have to send extra stock over to Belgium. Please bear with us and we are working to have everyone fulfilled on time.
Above and beyond everything, Larry Becker and I, as well as the entire Platypod team, wish to express our greatest thanks to God and to all our wonderful backers who have helped to support this project. A special shout out to Scott Kelby who truly inspired the idea of the Delta.
Best wishes,
Larry Tiefenbrunn “Dr. T”

@Byron the flow is usually: - when you make a pledge, it is marked but not charged by kickstarter yet. In most cases it isn't even showing as pending/reserved on my cards at best I see that there was a check if my card limit allows for such a transaction. - when the campaign ends kickstarter starts to make charges to cards. If a transaction fails it notifies the backer and does a couple of retries over the following days. It allows for up to two weeks before marking the transaction as failed which kicks you out as backer (the creator can choose to import such backers into a pledge management system like backerkit still to give the backer another chance to pay) - once kickstarter has collected *all* the funds possible it confirms what the creator will get in how many tranches. The creator may treat the money as available at this point but there is a risk still that he won't get (all of) it. - kickstarter then transfers the collected money to the creator which can take a few days again before the creator has got the money. At this point only it is pretty safe for the creator to assume what exact funds are available and start to operate. So in summary, this is all normal and has nothing to do with the creator. It is all in the hands of kickstarter so far.

content.title: Wow! Over 1700 backers and 1 week to go!!!
content.creator:
Larry Tiefenbrunn
February 8, 2025
content.content:
Delta is due to arrive in California over the next several days and I am pleased to confirm that we plan to begin shipments to our “early delivery” backers during the first week of March in the United States, and the second week elsewhere. Once the shipment (over 1200 units) arrives in California, it will be transferred over to Fedex where it will head to our fulfillment center in New Jersey. As soon as I get confirmation from FedEx that they have the shipment, I will post another update, hopefully prior to the end of this campaign.

With only one week to go, I have to say that we have surpassed expectations and I want to thank you all! Now is the time to please reach out to your friends and photography colleagues to let them know what we are doing, so that they too can take advantage of being first in line to receive the amazing new Platypod Delta. This would be much appreciated.

We just returned from ImagingUSA 2025 in Dallas, where hundreds of people had the opportunity to try out our new equipment. They were most enthusiastic about the Delta and the new Platyball Traveler ballhead as well. Their only disappointment was that they could not purchase a Delta then and there, but we guided them over to Kickstarter.

To summarize, here's the projected schedule:

February 15th: Kickstarter ends.

February 25th (give or take a few days): We will send out the BackerKit “Survey.” For those new to Kickstarter, the “Survey” is a necessary data-collection form to gather address and logistic information. These surveys will be accompanied by the “Add-on" store from BackerKit, where our backers will have the opportunity to purchase other Platypod equipment, as well as doubles or triples of their current offers at deep discounts. The flat rate shipping fee that appears at the bottom of the Kickstarter campaign will remain the same regardless of add-ons. Please be aware that many countries may charge VAT according to their own rules. Backers are responsible for local duties and VAT. We will not be charging VAT ourselves.

Barring any unforeseen inventory issues, we plan to send out all items in the add-on store, together with the respective rewards. In other words, if you ordered rewards for "early delivery" the add-ons should ship together. If that is not possible, we will try to contact you for alternatives. BACKERS will only have ONE opportunity to use the add-on store so please, try to decide in advance, which items you want. Go to www.platypod.com to research our various products and accessories.

March 3-7: shipping begins to “early delivery” backers throughout North and South America. 
March 10-14: shipping begins to “early delivery” backers for the rest of the world. These will ship out from Antwerp, Belgium.

April 1-15: shipping begins to all remaining backers.

One final note, our two fulfillment centers, the one in New Jersey and the one in Belgium, have algorithms that decide the best methods of delivery, combining price and speed of delivery. Therefore, we cannot tell you yet which carrier will bring your reward or exactly how long it will take. In the United States, the average delivery should take 2 to 7 days. Same in the European Union. In the rest of the world, the greatest delays usually occur due to your local customs authorities and that is totally out of our control. Expect anywhere from one week to six weeks in these locales. Please bear with us and we will try to make sure that everybody gets their rewards in very reasonable time.

We plan to post one more brief update prior to the close of the campaign, and again we want to thank everyone for your incredible support to help bring this wonderful product to market. We could not do this without you!

Best wishes,
Larry Tiefenbrunn

content.title: The Delta Journey, now with over 1000 backers!!!
content.creator:
Larry Tiefenbrunn
January 18, 2025
content.content:
We are happy to report that our brand new Delta Kickstarter campaign is off to a fantastic start. A sincere thanks to all of our backers!!

In fact, we have more than 1000 backers in our first week and only about 29 more days to go. The first round of manufacturing has already happened and the shipment is on the way to us before the end of February so we can quickly deliver on our promises to our “Early Delivery” backers for delivery in March. We have also started additional production with our manufacturer in China, but that next batch may be produced slightly slower because of the Chinese New Year. No worries, it will still be here ahead of time for delivery in April as promised. Please be aware that some “Early Backer” Reward Levels may sell out due to limited quantities.

Most people already know that we are based in the US and ship from New Jersey, but we have also recently established shipping to almost all of the EU from Belgium, so that will minimize VAT for our EU customers.
One final thing that Kickstarter backers know about is, many companies including Platypod, set up an “add-on store” and we will make this available to our backers as well. Essentially, when the Kickstarter campaign wraps up, you will get a survey from Backerkit that allows you to add multiple rewards as well as other Platypod products to your primary Kickstarter investment at a discount and without additional shipping charges! Watch for future updates as we get closer to the final days of the Delta Campaign.
All my best,

Larry Becker
